title: Holiday Flagship Early-Access & Pop-up Tests
highlights: Direct A/B: Arm A (markdown) vs Arm B (bundle+GWP+loyalty) inside same two-week window to isolate CPA and acquisition effects.
Unified targets: **10–15%** footfall lift (stretch **≥25%**), **20–30%** early-window share, CPA ≤**0.80×**, QR redemption ≥**5%** of visitors.
Measurement window: instrument door counts, QR→POS attribution and an 8-week post-event analysis to separate one-time visits from repeat value.
executive_summary: This two-week early-access and pop-up test compares Arm A (legacy markdown) vs Arm B (bundle + GWP + loyalty gating) to measure whether urgency and bundled value convert visits into durable enrollments and sales [^4][^3][^1]. Targets are **10–15%** detectable foot-traffic uplift (stretch ≥**25%** in top markets); early-window transaction share **20–30%** (vs ~12–15% baseline); event CPA ≤**0.80×** baseline; and QR/scan redemption ≥**5%** of footfall. To hit those numbers, teams must **within 30 days finalize cell definitions, instrument door counts and QR→POS links, lock creative and GWP logistics, and assign analytics owners with a control baseline and an 8‑week follow-up** [^4][^3][^1]. ### Quick scan
top_operator_moves: Finalize A/B cells and control definition for the two-week window (Arm A vs Arm B) and secure launch dates.
Deploy and validate tracking: door counts or proxy, QR→POS linking, and event-level loyalty enrollment attribution.
Lock creative, bundle/GWP inventory and staffing; assign analytics owners and a reporting cadence for 8-week follow-up.
